solution.text:
\(x=_{j}_^\circ,\,y=_{j}_^\circ,\,z=_{k}_^\circ,\,\)
\(\angle BCA=_{k}_^\circ\)
Now, \(\angle BCA=\angle CAD=_{k}_^\circ \rightarrow\)[alternate interior angles]
\(\)
Alternately,
In \(\triangle ABC,\)
\(\angle A + \angle B + \angle C=180^\circ\)
\(\Rightarrow \angle A +_{j}_+_{k}_=180\)
\(\Rightarrow \angle A=_{{180-j-k}}_^\circ\)
We know, EAD is a straight line.
Therefore, \(\angle EAB + \angle BAC + \angle CAD=180^\circ\)
\(\Rightarrow _{j}_ + _{{180-j-k}}_ + \angle CAD=180\)
\(\Rightarrow \angle CAD=_{k}_^\circ\)

content.text:
In the given figure, ABCD is a parallelogram.
\(x=_{j}_^\circ,\,y=_{j}_^\circ,\,z=_{k}_^\circ,\,\)
What is the value of the angle CAD?
